main event: A ball-shaped object was observed near Macon, Georgia on August 6, 1965.
interesting points: Two witnesses stated the object departed the area at a high rate of speed and was not determined to be any known aircraft.
Observations were made from several sources, but no markings or identifiers on the object could be observed.
The investigation conducted met with negative results and the case was closed.
The object was described as amber in color and approximately 20-30 feet in diameter at a distance of 10,000 feet.
The object remained visible for 5 minutes and vanished in the same location where it was first sighted.
witnesses: multiple observers, including Mr. and Mrs. Crawley and others
